tool.name: msnbase-filter-merge-msms
tool.description: Filter and merge MS/MS spectra using retention time and m/z information.
tool.command: /usr/local/bin/mergeFilterMS2.r msnbaserdata=$msnbase_filter_merge_msms_input_1 mzppm=$mzppm mzabs=$mzabs rtabs=$rtabs max_rt_range=$max_rt_range max_mz_range=$max_mz_range min_rt=$min_rt max_rt=$max_rt min_mz=$min_mz max_mz=$max_mz msms_intensity_threshold=$msms_intensity_threshold output=$msnbase_filter_merge_msms_output_1 output.pdf=$msnbase_filter_merge_msms_output_2;

param.name: msnbase_filter_merge_msms_input_1
param.label: msnbase-filter-merge-msms data

param.name: mzppm
param.label: mzppm
param.help: The ppm error used for merging MS/MS spectra

param.name: mzabs
param.label: mzabs
param.help: The absolute mass error (in Dalton) used for merging MS/MS spectra

param.name: rtabs
param.label: rtabs

param.label: max_rt_range

param.name: max_mz_range

param.name: min_rt
param.label: min_rt
param.help: Minimum retention time for selected precursors. Precursors with a lower retention time will be discarded.

param.name: max_rt
param.label: max_rt
param.help: Maximum retention time for selected precursors. Precursors with a higher retention time will be discarded.

param.name: min_mz
param.label: min_mz
param.help: Minimum m/z value for selected precursors. Precursors with a lower m/z value will be discarded.

param.name: max_mz
param.label: max_mz
param.help: Maximum m/z value for selected precursors. Precursors with a higher m/z value will be discarded.

========================= MSnBase Filter Merge MSMS =========================
----------- Description -----------
| This module is used to filter and merge MS/MS spectra by retention time and m/z values. In a first step, MS/MS spectra are grouped by their precursor m/z and retention time. Second, grouped spectra can be filtered by their precursors' m/z deviation (max_mz_range) or retention time deviation (max_rt_range). Furthermore, MS/MS spectra can be filtered by the minimum and maximum m/z and retention time values of their precursors. In a third step, grouped MS/MS spectra are merged into one single MS/MS spectrum. This step also includes the filtering of m/z peaks by their intensity (msms.intensity.threshold).
+------------------+-----------------+ | predecessor tool | successor tool | +------------------+-----------------+ | msnbase-read-msms| msms2metfrag | +------------------+-----------------+
----------- Input files -----------
+--------------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +======================================+============+ | 1) msnbase-filter-merge-msms data | rdata | +--------------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
msnbase-filter-merge-msms data | A rdata file with MS/MS information retrieved from msnbase-read-msms |
mzppm | The ppm error used for merging MS/MS spectra |
mzabs | The absolute mass error (in seconds) used for merging MS/MS spectra |
rtabs | The retention time error (in seconds) used for merging MS/MS spectra |
max_rt_range | Permitted retention time window (in seconds) of grouped MS1 precursors. Grouped precursors that exceed that window will be discarded. |
max_mz_range | Permitted m/z window of grouped MS1 precursors. Grouped precoursors that exceed that window will be discarded. |
min_rt | Minimum retention time for selected precursors. Precursors with a lower retention time will be discarded. |
max_rt | Maximum retention time for selected precursors. Precursors with a higher retention time will be discarded. |
min_mz | Minimum m/z value for selected precursors. Precursors with a lower m/z value will be discarded. |
max_mz | Maximum m/z value for selected precursors. Precursors with a higher m/z value will be discarded. |
msms_intensity_threshold | Minimum intensity value for MS/MS peaks. Peaks with lower intensity values will be discarded. |
------------ Output files ------------
msnbase-filter-merge-msms data | A rdata file containing the filtered and merged MS/MS compound spectra |
msnbase-filter-merge-msms plot | PDF image to show grouping of MS/MS spectra |
